Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the sign was genuine and posted by transportation authorities, when in fact it was confirmed to be fake.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that all passengers were informed that they smelled and should wear deodorant, when there is no evidence to support this.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the sign was not actually posted by Transport for London, as confirmed by the authorities.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the possibility that the image of the sign may have been created as a joke or prank, rather than being a genuine sign posted in the London Underground.

Falters at times: There is no evidence of any faltering bias in the claim.
